etymology.interpretation: Combines acting beforehand with fixing an arrangement, yielding the sense of securing something ahead of time. Commonly used for tickets, hotels, and services.
etymology.simplification: 預→预 simplifies by dropping the 頁 component and adopting the simpler 予 form; 訂→订 replaces the 言 radical with its simplified form 讠 while retaining 丁 as phonetic.

parts.english: in advance; beforehand; to anticipate; to prepare
to order/book; to subscribe; to agree/fix; to revise/correct

examples.chinese: 我想预订两张明天去上海的火车票(我想預訂兩張明天去上海的火車票)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng yùdìng liǎng zhāng míngtiān qù Shànghǎi de huǒchē piào.
examples.english: I want to reserve two train tickets to Shanghai for tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅需要提前预订(這家餐廳需要提前預訂)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng xūyào tíqián yùdìng.
examples.english: This restaurant requires booking in advance.

examples.chinese: 我们已经在酒店预订了一个海景房(我們已經在酒店預訂了一個海景房)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yǐjīng zài jiǔdiàn yùdìng le yí gè hǎijǐng fáng.
examples.english: We have already reserved an ocean-view room at the hotel.
